weapons.name: AX-52
weapons.acq_text: AX-52's blueprint can be purchased from Amir of The Hex in the Höllvania Central Mall for 30,000 Standing 30,000 at Rank 4 - Hot & Fresh, requiring completion of The Hex to access.

weapons.name: Acceltra
weapons.acq_text: Acceltra's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating Demolisher Infested on the Dark Sector mission Ur, Uranus.

weapons.name: Ack_&_Brunt
weapons.acq_text: The Ack & Brunt's blueprint can be researched from the Chem Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Acrid
weapons.acq_text: The Acrid's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Aegrit
weapons.acq_text: Aegrit's blueprint is available from Chipper of Kahl's Garrison for 30 Stock, requiring players to be at Rank 4 - Settlement to purchase.

weapons.name: Aeolak
weapons.acq_text: Aeolak's main blueprint can be acquired from Tier 5 Chrysalith Bounties. The barrel blueprint drops from Void Cascade. The receiver and stock blueprints drop from Void Flood. All components can be traded, but not the main blueprint.

weapons.name: Afentis
weapons.acq_text: Afentis's blueprint is available from Chipper of Kahl's Garrison for 60 Stock, requiring players to be at Rank 5 - Home to purchase.

weapons.name: Afuris
weapons.acq_text: The Afuris's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Agkuza
weapons.acq_text: The Agkuza's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Akarius
weapons.acq_text: Akarius's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating Demolisher Infested on the Dark Sector mission Ur, Uranus.

weapons.name: Akaten
weapons.acq_text: The Akaten is automatically acquired upon claiming a Hound configured with the Hec Model. Note that this weapon also takes up one Sentinel inventory slot.

weapons.name: Aklato
weapons.acq_text: A built Aklato can be purchased from the Market for 25,000 Credits 25,000.

weapons.name: Aklex
weapons.acq_text: The Aklex's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Aklex_Prime
weapons.acq_text: The Void Relics containing the Aklex Prime components can be purchased from Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay; the Axi A2 costs 45,000 Credits 45,000 and 50  50 each, while the Neo O1 costs 55,000 Credits 55,000 and 125  125 each. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance and this relic may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Akvasto
weapons.acq_text: The Akvasto's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Akvasto_Prime
weapons.acq_text: The Void Relics containing the Akvasto Prime components can be purchased from Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 55,000 Credits 55,000 and 125  125 each. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance and this relic may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Akzani
weapons.acq_text: The Akzani's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Alternox
weapons.acq_text: Alternox's blueprint can be acquired from Tier 3 Chrysalith Bounties.

weapons.name: Ambassador
weapons.acq_text: This weapon's main blueprint can be acquired from Rotation C of Empyrean Survival missions in Venus Proxima, Neptune Proxima, Pluto Proxima, and Veil Proxima. The component blueprints are dropped by Aurax Atloc Raknoids and Narmer Raknoids. All parts can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Amphis
weapons.acq_text: The Amphis's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Ceres to Jupiter Junction.

weapons.name: Argo_&_Vel
weapons.acq_text: The Blueprint for Argo & Vel can be purchased in Teshin's Cave for 60 Pathos Clamp or 225 Platinum 225. Purchasing using the former will unlock the Drifter-compatible version and the blueprint for a Warframe-compatible version; purchasing using the latter will unlock both versions.

weapons.name: Arum_Spinosa
weapons.acq_text: The Arum Spinosa's blueprint and components can be acquired from Tier 2 (Lvl 40-50) Isolation Vault Bounties (normal and Arcana). The blueprint and all components can be traded.

weapons.name: Athodai
weapons.acq_text: Athodai was acquired by watching TennoCon 2020 on WARFRAME's Twitch with a Twitch-linked account for 30 consecutive minutes, between 12:30 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. ET, on August 1st, 2020. It comes with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Azima
weapons.acq_text: The Azima is exclusive to the Daily Tribute system. It will become available every 200 days, beginning at day 100, until chosen as the Milestone reward. The Azima comes with its own weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Azothane
weapons.acq_text: The Blueprint for Azothane can be purchased in Teshin's Cave for 50 Pathos Clamp or 250 Platinum 250. Purchasing using the former will unlock the Drifter-compatible version and the blueprint for a Warframe-compatible version; purchasing using the latter will unlock both versions.

weapons.acq_text: The Boltace's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Bolto
weapons.acq_text: The Bolto's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Boltor
weapons.acq_text: The Boltor's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, a built Boltor is awarded from completing the Venus to Mercury Junction, complete with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Brakk
weapons.acq_text: Brakk was initially an award for completing at least 100 missions supporting the Grineer invasions during The Gradivus Dilemma. After the event, a blueprint was handed out to players who supported the Corpus by running at least 100 invasions on their side, as compensation.

weapons.name: Braton
weapons.acq_text: A fully built Braton can be purchased from the Market for 25,000 Credits 25,000.

weapons.acq_text: This weapon can be sold for 7,500 Credits 7,500.

weapons.name: Braton_Vandal
weapons.acq_text:
All drop rates data is obtained from DE's official drop tables stored on Module:DropTables/data.
See Mission Rewards#Standard Missions for definitions on reward table rotations.
For more detailed definitions and information,
visit here.

weapons.name: Broken_Scepter
weapons.acq_text: A built Broken Scepter is given on completion of The War Within, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst. A second Broken Scepter will not be given on a replay.

weapons.name: Broken_War
weapons.acq_text: This weapon is granted as a reward for completing the The Second Dream quest with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Bronco
weapons.acq_text: The Bronco's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.acq_text: Last updated: Update 27.2 (2020-03-05)

weapons.name: Bubonico
weapons.acq_text: The Bubonico's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Burst_Laser
weapons.acq_text: The Burst Laser is automatically acquired upon obtaining Shade. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Burston
weapons.acq_text: The Burston's blueprint and the resources required for its construction are awarded upon completion of Vor's Prize quest. Additional blueprints can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Burston_Prime
weapons.acq_text: The Burston Prime can be sold for 7,500 Credits 7,500.

weapons.name: Buzlok
weapons.acq_text: The Buzlok's blueprint can be researched from the Chem Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Cadus
weapons.acq_text: The Cadus's blueprint can be purchased from the market for 50,000 Credits 50,000.

weapons.name: Cantare
weapons.acq_text: Cantare's blueprint is obtained from Ascension on Brutus, Uranus, at a 5% drop rate.

weapons.name: Cantic_Prism
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Carcinnox
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Carmine_Penta
weapons.acq_text: This weapon's blueprints and components can be obtained from Pluto Proxima or Veil Proxima Corpus-controlled Abandoned Derelict Caches in Empyrean missions. All parts can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Cassowar
weapons.acq_text: The Cassowar's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Castanas
weapons.acq_text: The Castana's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Catabolyst
weapons.acq_text: The Catabolyst's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Catchmoon
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint for the chamber can be bought from Rude Zuud for 500 Standing 500 at Rank 0 with Solaris United.

weapons.name: Caustacyst
weapons.acq_text: The Caustacyst's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Cedo
weapons.acq_text: Cedo's blueprint and components are available from Father with Entrati standing. The main blueprint requires players to be at Rank 4 - Friend, while components require Rank 5 - Family. Each item costs 5,000 Standing 5,000 Standing, totaling to 20,000 Standing 20,000. The blueprint and all components can be traded.

weapons.name: Centaur
weapons.acq_text: The Centaur's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Ceramic_Dagger
weapons.acq_text: The Ceramic Dagger's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Cerata
weapons.acq_text: The Cerata's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Cernos
weapons.acq_text: The Cernos's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Cernos_Prime
weapons.acq_text: Unlike most Prime gear, Cernos Prime is permanently unvaulted, with relics being obtainable through Abandoned Derelict Caches in Corpus Railjack missions.

weapons.name: Cestra
weapons.acq_text: The Cestra's blueprint can be purchased from the Market for 20,000 credits, while the built version can be purchased for 175 platinum (catalyst installed) . Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Jupiter to Europa Junction.

weapons.name: Cinta
weapons.acq_text: Cinta's main and component blueprints are acquired by solving the Enigma puzzles in The Duviri Experience. All blueprints are tradable.

weapons.name: Cobra_&_Crane
weapons.acq_text: The Cobra & Crane's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Cortege
weapons.acq_text: The Cortege main blueprint can be acquired by reaching Rank 3 - Clearance: Odima with the Necraloid. The main blueprint is offered as a rank up reward, but Loid sells additional main blueprints for 8,000 Standing 8,000. Components are crafted from blueprints that can be acquired for 4,000 Standing 4,000 each after reaching Rank 2 - Clearance: Modus with the syndicate. Once crafted, it comes with a pre-installed Gravimag.

weapons.name: Corufell
weapons.acq_text: Corufell's blueprint and components can be obtained from Mirror Defense Tyana Pass on Mars, whose access requires completion of Heart of Deimos; the blueprint comes from Rotation A, while the Barrel, Receiver, and Handle come from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Corvas
weapons.acq_text: The Corvas's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Cronus
weapons.acq_text: The Cronus's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating Captain Vor on Tolstoj, Mercury.

weapons.name: Cryophon
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Cryotra
weapons.acq_text: The Cryotra's blueprint can be purchased from Legs in Fortuna for 10,000 Standing 10,000, requiring Rank 5 - Old Mate with Solaris United. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Cyanex
weapons.acq_text: The Cyanex's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Cyath
weapons.acq_text: The Cyath blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Cycron
weapons.acq_text: The Cycron's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Cyngas
weapons.acq_text: The Cyngas's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Daikyu
weapons.acq_text: The Daikyu's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Dargyn
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Dark_Dagger
weapons.acq_text: The Dark Dagger's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Dark_Split-Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Dark Split-Sword's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Dark_Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Dark Sword's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Deconstructor
weapons.acq_text: The Deconstructor is automatically acquired upon obtaining Helios. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Dehtat
weapons.acq_text: The Dehtat blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Dera
weapons.acq_text: The Dera's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Dera_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: Blueprints and components are a potential Invasion reward. All components can be traded, although players must have a Mastery Rank of at least 7 to acquire the blueprint.

weapons.name: Desert_Wind
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Despair
weapons.acq_text: Despair's blueprint is dropped by both Stalker and Shadow Stalker. It is also included in the What Stalker? bundle for 800 Platinum 800 in the market.

weapons.name: Destreza
weapons.acq_text: The Destreza's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Deth_Machine_Rifle
weapons.acq_text: The Deth Machine Rifle is automatically acquired upon obtaining Dethcube. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Detron
weapons.acq_text: Blueprint and components are dropped by the Zanuka Hunter (can be summoned with Zanuka Hunter Beacon). Note that neither the components nor the crafted weapon are tradeable, and the weapon is not offered in the Market.

weapons.name: Dex_Dakra
weapons.acq_text: The Dex Dakra was released in commemoration of WARFRAME's 2nd Year Anniversary. It is obtainable through yearly anniversaries in March via Alerts, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Dex_Furis
weapons.acq_text: The Dex Furis was released in commemoration of WARFRAME's 1st Year Anniversary. It is obtainable through yearly anniversaries in March via Alerts, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Dex_Nikana
weapons.acq_text: The Dex Nikana was released in commemoration of WARFRAME's 11th Year Anniversary. It is obtainable by logging in between March 27 to December 31, 2024, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Dex_Pixia
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Dex_Sybaris
weapons.acq_text: The Dex Sybaris was released in commemoration of WARFRAME's 3rd Year Anniversary. It is obtainable through yearly anniversaries in March via Alerts, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Dissic_Scaffold
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Diwata
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Dokrahm
weapons.acq_text: The Dokrahm blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Dorrclave
weapons.acq_text: Dorrclave's main and component blueprints are acquired from Dagath's Hollow within the Clan Dojo. Unlike most Clan Dojo rooms, Dorrclave does not require Research and can be acquired immediately following the room's construction.

weapons.name: Dragon_Nikana
weapons.acq_text: The Dragon Nikana's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Drakgoon
weapons.acq_text: The Drakgoon's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Neptune to Pluto Junction.

weapons.name: Dread
weapons.acq_text: Dread's blueprint is dropped by the Stalker. It is also included in the What Stalker? bundle for 800 Platinum 800 in the market.

weapons.name: Dual_Cestra
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Cestra's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Dual_Cleavers
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Cleavers's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Dual_Decurion
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Decurion's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Dual_Ether
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Ether's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Dual_Heat_Swords
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Heat Sword's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Dual_Ichor
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Ichor's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Dual_Kamas
weapons.acq_text: The Dual Kamas's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Edun
weapons.acq_text: The Blueprint for Edun can be purchased in Teshin's Cave for 50 Pathos Clamp or 250 Platinum 250. Purchasing using the former will unlock the Drifter-compatible version and the blueprint for a Warframe-compatible version; purchasing using the latter will unlock both versions.

weapons.name: Ekhein
weapons.acq_text: Ekhein's blueprint is sold by Bird 3 of Cavia for 15,000 Standing 15,000, requiring Rank 3 - Colleague.

weapons.name: Embolist
weapons.acq_text: The Embolist's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Endura
weapons.acq_text: The Endura's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Epitaph
weapons.acq_text: This weapon's blueprint and components can be acquired from Void Storm missions in Earth Proxima, Venus Proxima, and Saturn Proxima. All parts can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Ether_Daggers
weapons.acq_text: The Ether Daggers' blueprint is rewarded by completing the Stolen Dreams quest. Additional blueprints can be bought from Cephalon Simaris for 100,000 Standing 100,000.

weapons.name: Ether_Reaper
weapons.acq_text: The Ether Reaper's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Ether_Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Ether Sword's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Evensong
weapons.acq_text: Evensong's blueprint is obtained from Ascension on Brutus, Uranus, at a 5% drop rate.

weapons.name: Falcor
weapons.acq_text: The Falcor's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Fang
weapons.acq_text: The Fang's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Pluto to Sedna Junction.

weapons.name: Fang_Prime
weapons.acq_text: On October 16th, 2018, a built Fang Prime, Vectis Prime and an exclusive Sugatra were available as Twitch Prime benefits.

weapons.name: Felarx
weapons.acq_text: Felarx's main blueprint is purchased from Cavalero of The Holdfasts at Rank 3 - Guardian for 8,000 Standing 8,000 Standing. The blueprint can be traded.

weapons.name: Ferrox
weapons.acq_text: The Ferrox's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Fluctus
weapons.acq_text: The Fluctus's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Flux_Rifle
weapons.acq_text: The Flux Rifle's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Fragor
weapons.acq_text: The Fragor's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, a built Fragor is awarded upon completing the Earth to Mars Junction, complete with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Gazal_Machete
weapons.acq_text: The Gazal Machete's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Gaze
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint for the chamber can be bought from Rude Zuud for 500 Standing 500 at Rank 0 with Solaris United.

weapons.name: Ghoulsaw
weapons.acq_text: The Ghoulsaw's main and component blueprints could be acquired after reaching Rank 3 - Champion with Operational Supply during Operation: Plague Star and buying it from Nakak. The main blueprint costs 4,000 Standing 4,000 + 1,500 Credits 1,500, while the component blueprints costs 4,000 Standing 4,000 + 3,500 Credits 3,500, totaling to 20,000 Standing 20,000 + 15,500 Credits 15,500. All parts can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Glaive
weapons.acq_text: The Glaive's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Halikar
weapons.acq_text: The Halikar's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Halikar_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: The Halikar Wraith can be potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 350,000 Credits 350,000 and 450  450. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Hand_Grenade
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Harmony
weapons.acq_text: Harmony's blueprint is obtained from Ascension on Brutus, Uranus, at a 5% drop rate.

weapons.name: Harpak
weapons.acq_text: The Harpak's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Hate
weapons.acq_text: The Hate's blueprint is dropped by the (Shadow) Stalker. It is also included in the What Stalker? bundle for 800 Platinum 800 in the market.

weapons.name: Heat_Dagger
weapons.acq_text: The Heat Dagger's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Heat_Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Heat Sword blueprint is rewarded upon completion of the Once Awake Quest.

weapons.name: Hek
weapons.acq_text: The Hek's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Heliocor
weapons.acq_text: The Heliocor's blueprint can be purchased from Cephalon Simaris for 75,000 Standing 75,000.

weapons.name: Helstrum
weapons.acq_text: The Helstrum's blueprint can be purchased from Legs in Fortuna for 10,000 Standing 10,000, requiring Rank 5 - Old Mate with Solaris United. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Hema
weapons.acq_text: The Hema's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Hespar
weapons.acq_text: Hespar's main blueprint can be acquired from Tier 4 Chrysalith Bounties. The blade blueprint drops from Void Armageddon. The handle blueprint drops from Void Cascade. All components but the main blueprint can be traded.

weapons.name: Hikou
weapons.acq_text: The Hikou's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Hikou_Prime
weapons.acq_text: Unlike most Prime gear, Hikou Prime is permanently unvaulted, with relics being obtainable through Abandoned Derelict Caches in Corpus Railjack missions.

weapons.name: Imperator
weapons.acq_text: A built Imperator is automatically acquired upon claiming the Odonata Archwing from the Foundry during The Archwing quest.

weapons.name: Imperator_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: The Imperator Vandal was awarded during the Operation: Eyes of Blight event for obtaining 15 (PC)/10 (PS4/XB1) Battle Points, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Innodem
weapons.acq_text: Innodem's main blueprint is purchased from Cavalero of The Holdfasts at Rank 1 - Fallen for 5,500 Standing 5,500. The blueprint can be traded.

weapons.name: Iron_Staff
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Ironbride
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Jat_Kittag
weapons.acq_text: The Jat Kittag's blueprint can be researched from the Chem Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Jat_Kusar
weapons.acq_text: The Jat Kusar's blueprint can be researched from the Chem Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Javlok
weapons.acq_text: The Javlok's blueprint can be researched from the Chem Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Jaw_Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Jaw Sword's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Kama
weapons.acq_text: The Kama's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Karak
weapons.acq_text: The Karak's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Karak_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: Karak Wraith was introduced during the Operation: Tubemen of Regor event, where players would need to complete a minimum of four regional battles in favor of one side more than the other, and Alad V was the victor of the conflict. Alad V had won the conflict in the PC and XB1 versions of the game, but not in the PS4. The weapon was fully built and came with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Karyst
weapons.acq_text: The Karyst's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Kaszas
weapons.acq_text: The Kaszas's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Keratinos
weapons.acq_text: Keratinos are acquired by reaching Rank 0 - Neutral with the Entrati. Father sells the main blueprint for 1,000 Standing 1,000 and component blueprints for 500 Standing 500; a total of 3,000 Standing 3,000 is needed for all parts.

weapons.name: Kompressa
weapons.acq_text: Roky sells the main blueprint and component blueprints to Tenno at Rank 5 - Logical with Ventkids. She will sell the blueprints for 25,000 Standing 25,000 each; a total of 75,000 Standing 75,000 is needed for all parts. Alternatively50,000 Standing 50,000 if one component reward is claimed upon reaching Rank 5 - Logical

weapons.name: Korrudo
weapons.acq_text: Korrudo's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating a Tusk Thumper Bull or Tusk Thumper Doma in the Plains of Eidolon. Thumper Bulls and Domas generally appear in Tier 4 or higher Bounties or The Steel Path when roaming the plains, and only spawn during the daytime.

weapons.name: Korumm
weapons.acq_text: Korumm's blueprint is acquired from Narmer Bounties after completion of The New War.

weapons.name: Laser_Rifle
weapons.acq_text: The Laser Rifle is automatically acquired upon obtaining Wyrm. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Lato
weapons.acq_text: During Awakening, the Lato is one of two secondary weapons offered to the player, the other being the MK1-Kunai.

weapons.name: Lato_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was available to anyone who logged in during the Closed Beta (Excluding the Open Beta Weekend) upon the game transitioning into Open Beta (Update 7.0 (2013-03-18)). It originally had no rank restriction, so anyone who logged in during the Closed Beta could acquire it, regardless of time spent playing the game.

weapons.name: Machete_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: The Machete Wraith was first introduced as a potential reward from The Gradivus Dilemma event if players fought in 25 battles and the conflict favored the Grineer. As the Grineer succeeded in the event, the weapon was awarded, complete with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Mausolon
weapons.acq_text: A built Mausolon is automatically acquired upon claiming any Necramech, either the Voidrig or the Bonewidow, from the Foundry. Functioning as their default weapon option, the Mausolon also comes with the necessary Gravimag already pre-installed.

weapons.name: Mewan
weapons.acq_text: The Mewan blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Milati
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Mios
weapons.acq_text: The Mios's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Mire
weapons.acq_text: The Mire's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Pluto to Eris Junction.

weapons.name: Miter
weapons.acq_text: Miter's main blueprint and components can be obtained from the dual boss team Lech Kril and Captain Vor on Exta, Ceres.

weapons.name: Morgha
weapons.acq_text: The Morgha main blueprint can be acquired by reaching Rank 3 - Clearance: Odima with the Necraloid. The main blueprint is offered as a rank up reward, but Loid sells additional main blueprints for 8,000 Standing 8,000. Components are crafted from blueprints that can be acquired for 4,000 Standing 4,000 each after reaching Rank 2 - Clearance: Modus with the syndicate. Once crafted, it comes with a pre-installed Gravimag.

weapons.name: Onorix
weapons.acq_text: The Onorix's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Onos
weapons.acq_text: Onos's blueprint can be obtained from Disruption Armatus on Deimos, whose access requires completion of The Deadlock Protocol and Whispers in the Walls, from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Ooltha
weapons.acq_text: The Ooltha blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Opticor
weapons.acq_text: The Opticor's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Opticor_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: This weapon is awarded for earning 100 points from the recurring Thermia Fractures event that was first introduced in Operation: Buried Debts, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst. The points are cumulative across all Thermia Fractures events, thus the weapon can only be acquired once this way.

weapons.acq_text: The Orthos's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Pathocyst
weapons.acq_text: Pathocyst's main blueprint and components can be obtained from defeating Zealoid Prelate on Exequias, Deimos. All parts are tradeable between players.

weapons.name: Pencha_Scaffold
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Pennant
weapons.acq_text: The Pennant's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating Blite Captain, Glacik Commander, Lektro Commander, or Pyr Captain in Empyrean missions (at Kasio's Rest on Saturn Proxima, Flexa in Veil Proxima, or sometimes Korms Belt in Earth Proxima). The blueprint pickup is shared across the entire squad and can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Penta
weapons.acq_text: The Penta's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Jupiter to Saturn Junction.

weapons.name: Perigale
weapons.acq_text: Perigale's blueprint and components can be obtained from Conjunction Survival Yuvarium and Circulus on Lua, whose access requires completion of The War Within; the blueprint comes from Rotation A, while the Barrel, Receiver, and Stock come from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Phaedra
weapons.acq_text: The Phaedra's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates, with the receiver also being rare drop from Archwing Exterminate on Montes, Venus and Syrtis, Mars. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Phage
weapons.acq_text: The Phage's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Phahd_Scaffold
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Phantasma
weapons.acq_text: The Phantasma's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Phantasma_Prime

weapons.name: Phenmor
weapons.acq_text: Phenmor's main blueprint is purchased from Cavalero of The Holdfasts at Rank 2 - Watcher for 6,000 Standing 6,000 Standing. The blueprint can be traded.

weapons.name: Photor
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Plague_Keewar
weapons.acq_text: This strike primarily deals Slash damage

weapons.name: Plague_Kripath
weapons.acq_text: This strike primarily deals Puncture damage

weapons.name: Plasma_Sword
weapons.acq_text: The Plasma Sword's blueprint can be bought from Nightwave Offerings. Note that the offerings are on a 7-day rotation, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Plinx
weapons.acq_text: The Plinx's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Pox
weapons.acq_text: The Pox's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Praedos
weapons.acq_text: Praedos' main blueprint is purchased from Cavalero of The Holdfasts at Rank 4 - Seraph for 9,000 Standing 9,000 Standing. The blueprint can be traded.

weapons.name: Prisma_Angstrum
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Angstrum can be sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 210,000 Credits 210,000 and 475  475. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Burst_Laser
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Burst Laser is automatically acquired upon purchasing Prisma Shade from Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 300,000 Credits 300,000 and 500  500. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this item may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Dual_Cleavers
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Dual Cleavers is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 200,000 Credits 200,000 and 490  490. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Dual_Decurions
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Dual Decurions is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 175,000 Credits 175,000 and 525  525. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Gorgon
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Gorgon is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 50,000 Credits 50,000 and 600  600. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Grakata
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Grakata is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 100,000 Credits 100,000 and 610  610. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Grinlok
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Grinlok is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 220,000 Credits 220,000 and ‍500  500. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Lenz
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Lenz is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 200,000 Credits 200,000 and 575  575. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Machete
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Machete can be purchased from Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 200,000 Credits 200,000 and 400  400. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Obex
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Obex is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 175,000 Credits 175,000 and 500  500. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Ohma
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Ohma is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 175,000 Credits 175,000 and 450  450. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Skana
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Skana is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 175,000 Credits 175,000 and 510  510. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Tetra
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Tetra is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 50,000 Credits 50,000 and 400  400. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Twin_Gremlins
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Twin Gremlins is sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 220,000 Credits 220,000 and 500  500. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Prisma_Veritux
weapons.acq_text: The Prisma Veritux is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 150,000 Credits 150,000 and 550  550. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Proboscis_Cernos
weapons.acq_text: The Proboscis Cernos's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Propa_Scaffold
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint is sold by Little Duck for 3,000 Standing 3,000 standing and requires a rank of Instrument to purchase. It is also a possible rank-up reward for advancing to Instrument with Vox Solaris.

weapons.name: Prova
weapons.acq_text: The Prova can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Prova_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: The Prova Vandal is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 250,000 Credits 250,000 and 410  410. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Pugil
weapons.acq_text: Necramechs can be piloted by an Operator (which requires completion of The War Within) via Transference, whether they are found in the Cambion Drift or owned by the player.

weapons.name: Pulmonars
weapons.acq_text: The Pulmonars' blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Pulsar
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Pupacyst
weapons.acq_text: The Pupacyst's blueprint can be researched from the Bio Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Pyrana
weapons.acq_text: The Pyrana's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Quanta
weapons.acq_text: The Quanta's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Quanta_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was originally obtained by gaining at least 1,500 points in the Operation False Profit event, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Quartakk
weapons.acq_text: The Quartakk's blueprint can be acquired as a reward from performing special Ghoul Purge Bounties, or dropped by Ghoul Auger Alphas. The built weapon can also be bought from the Market individually, or as part of the Maggor Assault Pack.

weapons.name: Quassus
weapons.acq_text: The Quassus's blueprint can be obtained from Tier 5 Cambion Drift Bounties.

weapons.name: Quellor
weapons.acq_text: The Quellor's main blueprint can be obtained from defeating Blite Captain, Glacik Commander, Lektro Commander, or Pyr Captain in Empyrean missions (at Kasio's Rest on Saturn Proxima,  Flexa in Veil Proxima, or sometimes Korms Belt in Earth Proxima). The blueprint pickup is shared across the entire squad and can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Rabvee
weapons.acq_text: The Rabvee blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Rahn_Prism
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Rakta_Ballistica
weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Rakta_Cernos
weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Rakta_Dark_Dagger
weapons.acq_text: Advantages over other Melee weapons (excluding modular weapons):

weapons.name: Rampart
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Raplak_Prism
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Rathbone
weapons.acq_text: The Rathbone's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Rattleguts
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint for the chamber can be bought from Rude Zuud for 500 Standing 500 at Rank 0 with Solaris United.

weapons.name: Rauta
weapons.acq_text: In the first two weeks after The Seven Crimes of Kullervo launched (June 21st, 2023 @ 12 PM ET until July 5th, 2023 @ 12 PM ET), entering Duviri via the Star Chart banner and Dormizone door would present all players with an event mission called Kullervo's Hold, which was based on The Lone Story's spiral-focused gameplay and always included the dungeon island in the Duviri Landscape regardless of the current Mood Spiral. This limited-time access required 5 Pathos Clamps.

weapons.name: Regulators
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Ripkas
weapons.acq_text: The Ripkas's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Rubico
weapons.acq_text: The Rubico's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Rumblejack
weapons.acq_text: Rumblejack is given upon completion of The New War, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Ruvox
weapons.acq_text: Ruvox's blueprint and components can be obtained from Disruption Armatus on Deimos, whose access requires completion of The Deadlock Protocol and Whispers in the Walls; all parts come from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Sampotes
weapons.acq_text: The Blueprint for Sampotes can be purchased in Teshin's Cave for 60 Pathos Clamp or 275 Platinum 275. Purchasing using the former will unlock the Drifter-compatible version and the blueprint for a Warframe-compatible version; purchasing using the latter will unlock both versions.

weapons.name: Sancti_Castanas
weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Sancti_Magistar
weapons.acq_text: Unlock Challenge: Complete a solo mission with this weapon equipped.

weapons.name: Sancti_Tigris
weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Sarofang
weapons.acq_text: Sarofang's blueprint and components can be obtained from Conjunction Survival Yuvarium and Circulus on Lua, whose access requires completion of The War Within; the blueprint comes from Rotation A, while the Blade and Handle come from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Sarpa
weapons.acq_text: The Sarpa's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Scindo
weapons.acq_text: The Scindo' blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Scindo_Prime
weapons.acq_text: Unlike most Prime gear, Scindo Prime is permanently unvaulted, with relics being obtainable through Abandoned Derelict Caches in Corpus Railjack missions.

weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Secura_Penta
weapons.acq_text: Edit

weapons.name: Seer
weapons.acq_text: Seer's main blueprint and components can be obtained from defeating Captain Vor on Tolstoj, Mercury.

weapons.name: Sepfahn
weapons.acq_text: The Sepfahn blueprint can be acquired after reaching the Rank of Neutral with the Ostrons and buying it from Hok for 1,000 Standing 1,000.

weapons.name: Sepulcrum
weapons.acq_text: Sepulcrum is acquired by reaching Rank 2 - Acquaintance with the Entrati. Father sells the main blueprint for 4,000 Standing 4,000 and component blueprints for 2,000 Standing 2,000; a total of 8,000 Standing 8,000 is needed for all parts. The main blueprint is also offered as a rank-up reward.

weapons.name: Serro
weapons.acq_text: The Serro's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Shadow_Claws
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Shaku
weapons.acq_text: The Shaku's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Shedu
weapons.acq_text: The weapon blueprint is given to the player at the end of the Erra quest. Additional blueprints can be bought from Cephalon Simaris for 100,000 Standing 100,000.

weapons.name: Sheev
weapons.acq_text: Sheev's blueprint and components are seasonal offerings exclusive to the October Nights of Naberus event, during which they can be purchased from Daughter for Mother Token; the blueprint costs 125 tokens while the components cost 25, totaling 200 tokens.

weapons.name: Shraksun_Scaffold
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Shwaak_Prism
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Sibear
weapons.acq_text: The Sibear's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Sicarus
weapons.acq_text: A built Sicarus can be bought from the Market for 20,000 Credits 20,000.

weapons.name: Sigma_&_Octantis
weapons.acq_text: Sigma & Octantis is exclusive to the Daily Tribute system. It will become available every 200 days, beginning at day 300, until chosen as the Milestone reward. It comes with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.acq_text: The Silva & Aegis's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Simulor
weapons.acq_text: The Simulor's blueprint can be purchased from Cephalon Simaris for 75,000 Standing 75,000.

weapons.name: Sirocco
weapons.acq_text: The Drifter acquires this weapon in The Duviri Paradox off the body of a Dax executor and serves as their sole firearm throughout Duviri. In the Origin System side, this Amp is given upon completion of The New War, complete with a free amp slot and is pre-Gilded. Additional copies of Sirocco can be bought from Cephalon Simaris for 100,000 Standing 100,000.

weapons.name: Skana
weapons.acq_text: During Awakening, the Skana is one of two melee weapons offered to the player, the other being the MK1-Bo.

weapons.name: Skiajati
weapons.acq_text: This weapon, along with Excalibur Umbra fused to rank 5. A second Skiajati will not be given after replaying the quest.

weapons.name: Slaytra
weapons.acq_text: Slaytra's blueprint is available from Chipper of Kahl's Garrison for 30 Stock, requiring players to be at Rank 2 - Encampment to purchase.

weapons.name: Snipetron
weapons.acq_text:
The blueprint occasionally returns as an offering sold by Nakak in Cetus during the Operation: Plague Star event for 3,000 Standing 3,000 Operational Supply and 5,000 Credits 5,000.
The blueprint is available from Ticker in Fortuna during the Star Days event for 10 Advances Debt-Bonds.

weapons.name: Snipetron_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: This weapon's blueprint and parts can currently be found as Invasion rewards.

weapons.name: Soaktron
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Sobek
weapons.acq_text: The Sobek's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Soma
weapons.acq_text: The Soma's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.acq_text: The Sonicor's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Spari_Spear
weapons.acq_text: No available source for the item yet

weapons.name: Spectra
weapons.acq_text: The Spectra's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Spectra_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was awarded for earning 1,000 points in a single Endurance Disruption Mission in Operation: Hostile Mergers, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Sporelacer
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint for the chamber can be bought from Father for 500 Standing 500 at Rank 0 with Entrati.

weapons.name: Sporothrix
weapons.acq_text: The Sporothrix's blueprint and components can be acquired from Lvl 50-60 Isolation Vault Bounties (normal and Arcana). The blueprint and all components can be traded.

weapons.name: Stahlta
weapons.acq_text: The Stahlta's main blueprint is a possible reward from defeating the Jackal. Components can be acquired from within the Granum Void; the Receiver from Rotation C, the Stock from Rotation C of Exemplar Granum Void, and the Barrel from Rotation C of the Zenith Granum Void. All components can be traded between players, but not the main blueprint.

weapons.name: Staticor
weapons.acq_text: The Staticor's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Steflos
weapons.acq_text: Steflos's blueprint and components can be obtained from Mirror Defense Tyana Pass on Mars, whose access requires completion of Heart of Deimos; the blueprint comes from Rotation A, while the Barrel, Receiver, and Stock come from Rotation B.

weapons.name: Stinger
weapons.acq_text: The Stinger is automatically acquired upon obtaining Djinn. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Stradavar
weapons.acq_text: The Stradavar's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Stropha
weapons.acq_text: The Stropha's main blueprint is a possible reward from defeating the Jackal. Component blueprints can be acquired from within the Granum Void; the Barrel and Blade from Rotation C, the Receiver from Rotation C of Exemplar Granum Void, and the Stock from Rotation C of the Zenith Granum Void. All components can be traded between players, but not the main blueprint.

weapons.name: Strun
weapons.acq_text: A built Strun can be purchased from the Market for 25,000 Credits 25,000.

weapons.name: Strun_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was first introduced from the Survival Weekend Event, awarded for completing the event's Survival for 20 minutes, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Stubba
weapons.acq_text: The Stubba's blueprint can be acquired as a reward from performing special Ghoul Purge Bounties or dropped by Ghoul Rictus Alphas. It can also be bought from the Market individually, or as part of the Maggor Assault Pack.
acq_table: Ghoul Purge Bounty Lvl 15-25 Final Stage

weapons.name: Stug
weapons.acq_text: The Stug's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Sun_&_Moon
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint is rewarded on completion of The Duviri Paradox Quest. Additional copies can be purchased from Cephalon Simaris for 100,000 Standing 100,000.

weapons.name: Supra
weapons.acq_text: The Supra's blueprint can be researched from the Energy Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Supra_Vandal
weapons.acq_text: The Supra Vandal was awarded to players who successfully defeated Ambulas on Hades, Pluto during the Operation: Ambulas Reborn event, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Sweeper
weapons.acq_text: This Sentinel weapon is automatically acquired upon obtaining  Carrier. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Syam
weapons.acq_text: The Blueprint for Syam can be purchased in Teshin's Cave for 50 Pathos Clamp or 250 Platinum 250. Purchasing using the former will unlock the Drifter-compatible version and the blueprint for a Warframe-compatible version; purchasing using the latter will unlock both versions.

weapons.name: Sybaris
weapons.acq_text: The Sybaris' blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Veldt
weapons.acq_text: The Veldt's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Velocitus
weapons.acq_text: The Velocitus's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo. Its parts can be purchased from various Syndicates. All parts, except for the blueprint, are tradeable.

weapons.name: Velox
weapons.acq_text: The Velox's component parts can be acquired from within the Granum Void; the Barrel from Rotation C, the Receiver from Rotation C of Extended Granum Void. The main blueprint can be purchased from the Market. All components, except for the blueprint, can be traded between players.

weapons.name: Venato
weapons.acq_text: The Venato's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Venka
weapons.acq_text: The Venka's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Venka_Prime
weapons.acq_text: Unlike most Prime gear, Venka Prime is permanently unvaulted, with relics being obtainable through Abandoned Derelict Caches in Corpus Railjack missions.

weapons.name: Verdilac
weapons.acq_text: Verdilac's blueprint is acquired from Narmer Bounties after completion of The New War.
acq_table: Narmer Fortuna Bounty Lvl 50-70 Stage 4 / A
Narmer Cetus Bounty Lvl 50-70 Stage 5 / A
Narmer Fortuna Bounty Lvl 50-70 Stage 5 / A
Narmer Cetus Bounty Lvl 50-70 Stage 4 / A

weapons.name: Verglas
weapons.acq_text: The Verglas is automatically acquired upon obtaining Nautilus. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Vericres
weapons.acq_text: The Vericres is potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 200,000 Credits 200,000 and 410  410. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Veritux
weapons.acq_text: A built Veritux is automatically acquired upon claiming the Odonata Archwing from the Foundry during The Archwing quest.

weapons.name: Vermisplicer
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint for the chamber can be bought from Father for 500 Standing 500 at Rank 0 with Entrati.

weapons.name: Viper
weapons.acq_text: The Viper's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Viper_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: The Viper Wraith can be potentially sold by Baro Ki'Teer in the Concourse section of the Tenno Relay for 75,000 Credits 75,000 and 400  400. Note that Baro Ki'Teer's stock changes with each appearance, and this weapon may not be available on a succeeding appearance.

weapons.name: Vitrica
weapons.acq_text: The Vitrica's blueprint was obtained after defeating Nihil in Nightwave: Series 3, Episode 5.

weapons.name: Volnus
weapons.acq_text: The Volnus's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Volnus_Prime

weapons.name: Vulcax
weapons.acq_text: The Vulcax's blueprint can be purchased from Legs in Fortuna for 10,000 Standing 10,000, requiring Rank 5 - Old Mate with Solaris United. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: Vulkar
weapons.acq_text: The Vulkar's blueprint can be purchased from the Market. Alternatively, it can be acquired from completing the Mars to Ceres Junction.

weapons.name: Vulkar_Wraith
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was first awarded from Operation: Shadow Debt to players who defeated the final challenger, complete with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Vulklok
weapons.acq_text: The Vulklok is automatically acquired upon obtaining Diriga. Note that this weapon also takes up one Companion inventory slot.

weapons.name: War
weapons.acq_text: The War's blueprint is dropped by the Shadow Stalker. It is also included in the Hunhow's Gift bundle for 516 Platinum 516 in the market.

weapons.name: Wolf_Sledge
weapons.acq_text: Wolf Sledge's main blueprint and components can be acquired as random drops after defeating the Wolf of Saturn Six. All parts are tradeable between players.

weapons.name: Xoris
weapons.acq_text: The blueprint, core, handle, and blade are all obtained during The Deadlock Protocol. Additional blueprints and parts can be bought from Cephalon Simaris for 100,000 Standing 100,000 and 15,000 Standing 15,000 respectively.

weapons.name: Zakti
weapons.acq_text: The Zakti's blueprint can be researched from the Tenno Lab in the dojo.

weapons.name: Zarr
weapons.acq_text: The Zarr's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Zenistar
weapons.acq_text: The Zenistar is exclusive to the Daily Tribute system. It will become available every 200 days, beginning at day 100, until chosen as the Milestone reward. It comes with a free weapon slot and pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Zenith
weapons.acq_text: The Zenith is exclusive to the Daily Tribute system. It will become available every 200 days, beginning at day 100, until chosen as the Milestone reward. The weapon comes with its own weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Zhuge
weapons.acq_text: The Zhuge's blueprint can be purchased from the Market.

weapons.name: Zylok
weapons.acq_text: This weapon was introduced during the The Pyrus Project event. To receive the weapon, players had to complete all four tasks related to the reconstruction of the Strata Relay: contributing 30 Pyrus Essence and 5 Relay Strut Components, completing 1 Simaris Daily Synthesis Task, and defeating the Grustrag Three 3 times. The weapon comes with a free weapon slot and a pre-installed Orokin Catalyst.

weapons.name: Zymos
weapons.acq_text: Zymos is acquired by reaching Rank 1 - Stranger with the Entrati. Father sells the main blueprint for 2,000 Standing 2,000 and component blueprints for 1,000 Standing 1,000; a total of 4,000 Standing 4,000 is needed for all parts. The main blueprint is also offered as a rank-up reward.
